member.name: T:ElecNetKit.Experimentation.ChainExperimentor
member.summary: Chains multiple experimentors together. Each sub-experimentor is given the same initial input network, and should provide commands that will be run on the network in the order given by .

member.name: T:ElecNetKit.Experimentation.IExperimentor
member.summary: Defines an interface for conducting experiments on the network.
member.remarks: When the runs a simulation, it calls , passing a and expecting a list of simulator-specific commands to manipulate the network. Results are then fed through to a Results Core.Transform or a graph.

member.name: M:ElecNetKit.Experimentation.IExperimentor.Experiment(ElecNetKit.NetworkModelling.NetworkModel)
member.summary: Examines the network model and issues commands in order to manipulate or experiment upon the network model. Called by .
member.param: A network to experiment on.
member.returns: A list of simulator-specific commands to be fed into the simulator by the associated .

member.name: M:ElecNetKit.Experimentation.ChainExperimentor.#ctor
member.summary: Instantiates a new with an empty experiment chain.

member.name: M:ElecNetKit.Experimentation.ChainExperimentor.Experiment(ElecNetKit.NetworkModelling.NetworkModel)
member.summary: Obtains simulator-specific experiment commands pertaining to each in order and aggregates them into a single experiment.
member.param: The network to experiment upon.
member.returns: A list of simulator-specific experiment commands.

member.name: P:ElecNetKit.Experimentation.ChainExperimentor.Experimentors
member.summary: A list of sub-experiments. Sub-experiments will be executed in order.

member.name: T:ElecNetKit.Experimentation.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: The namespace contains classes that govern the definition of electrical network simulation experiments.

member.name: T:ElecNetKit.NetworkModelling.Bus
member.summary: es are the 'glue' that hold other network elements together, and as such, every other network element must be connected to at least one . es also store information on load-flow voltages, and have a location that is useful for graphing.

member.name: M:ElecNetKit.NetworkModelling.Bus.#ctor(System.String,System.Numerics.Complex,System.Double,System.Nullable{System.Windows.Point})
member.summary: Instantiates a new . This is the single-phase/balanced three-phase constructor. Use this only if your model will be used for balanced network analysis.
member.param: The ID of the bus. Should be unique among buses, but does not need to be unique amongst all network elements.
The single-phase absolute voltage of the bus (in Volts).
The single-phase base voltage of the bus (in Volts).
The XY coordinates of the bus. Used for graphing the network.

member.summary: Instantiates a new . This constructor supports arbitrarily-phased networks, including three-phase balanced and single-phase.
member.param: The ID of the bus. Should be unique among buses, but does not need to be unique amongst all network elements.

member.name: P:ElecNetKit.NetworkModelling.Bus.Voltage
member.summary: The single-phase (Line-Neutral) voltage (in complex phasor notation) of the bus. A single-phase, or balanced three-phase network is assumed.

member.summary: The voltage of each bus phase, in complex notation.

member.summary: The XY location of the bus, in network coordinates, useful for graphing.

member.name: P:ElecNetKit.NetworkModelling.Bus.BaseVoltage
member.summary: The Single-Phase base voltage of the bus (e.g. 11/sqrt(3) kV, 0.23 kV).

member.name: P:ElecNetKit.NetworkModelling.Bus.VoltagePU
member.summary: The single-phase voltage of the bus in p.u. terms, defined as /. Assumes a single-phase or balanced three-phase network.

member.name: P:ElecNetKit.NetworkModelling.Bus.VoltagePUPhased
member.summary: The voltage of the bus in p.u. terms for each phase, defined as /.

member.name: T:ElecNetKit.NetworkModelling.Phasing.PhasedEvaluated`2
member.summary: applies transforms to the values from an underlying in order to obtain new values.
member.remarks: is useful for providing phased convenience properties to classes when there is no difference in underlying data.
member.example: Consider the two properties of electrical network buses: voltage, and per-unit voltage. There is no point in storing these values twice in a network element model: The per-unit voltage would be redundant, as it is defined as (Voltage/BaseVoltage), and both of these values are stored in the network element. In such cases, it is best to use a for implementation:
member.typeparam: The type of the base phased object.
The type of the values of this phased object.

member.param: A transform translating values from to this , for get operations.
A transform translating values from this to , for set operations.

member.name: M:ElecNetKit.NetworkModelling.Tracing.TraceFromWithCallback(ElecNetKit.NetworkModelling.Bus,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{ElecNetKit.NetworkModelling.Bus},System.Action{ElecNetKit.NetworkModelling.Bus,ElecNetKit.NetworkModelling.Line,ElecNetKit.NetworkModelling.Bus})
member.summary: Traces from along all buses in , and executing for every connection between two buses.
member.param: The bus to trace from.
All buses that are to be allowed in the trace.
A custom action to execute for every connection.

member.name: T:ElecNetKit.Engines.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: The namespace contains simulator backends for the Electric Network Toolkit. Note that no engines are provided within the core assembly, so references to ElecNetKit.Engines.* assemblies should be added before use of these backends.

member.name: T:ElecNetKit.Simulator.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: The namespace defines a set of classes for controlling simulation, and managing external simulator integration.

member.name: T:ElecNetKit.Transform.DifferenceTransform
member.summary: Measures the change in voltage magnitudes and phases between a pre- and post- experiment network. Saves the computed differences back into the final for processing, traversing or graphing.

member.name: T:ElecNetKit.Transform.IResultsTransform
member.summary: Classes that implement are used for observing and modifying the electrical network model pre- and post- experiment. They meaningfully reinterpret the results obtained by experimentation in order to be better visualised or stored.

member.name: M:ElecNetKit.Transform.IResultsTransform.PreExperimentHook(ElecNetKit.NetworkModelling.NetworkModel)
member.summary: Called by a before experiment commands are run, providing the with a chance to measure or manipulate network parameters before experiment.
member.param: The un-experimented network.

member.name: M:ElecNetKit.Transform.IResultsTransform.PostExperimentHook(ElecNetKit.NetworkModelling.NetworkModel)
member.summary: Called by a after experiment commands are run. Implementors should meaningfully measure or modify the to enable better analysis of results.
member.param: The electrical network model, post-experiment.

member.name: M:ElecNetKit.Transform.DifferenceTransform.PreExperimentHook(ElecNetKit.NetworkModelling.NetworkModel)
member.summary: Store original bus voltage magnitudes by BusID in oldVoltages. See for how this fits into the system.
member.param: The original, unexperimented network.

member.name: M:ElecNetKit.Transform.DifferenceTransform.PostExperimentHook(ElecNetKit.NetworkModelling.NetworkModel)
member.summary: Subtracts old bus voltage magnitudes from new bus voltage magnitudes. Note that this will screw around with the phases due to subtraction of magnitudes, not of complex vectors.
member.param: The network to transform.

member.name: T:ElecNetKit.Transform.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: The namespace contains interfaces and classes associated with transforming results from network experiments.

member.name: T:ElecNetKit.Util.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: Defines a few bells and whistles that are used throughout ElecNetKit and might be useful in potential applications.

member.returns: A random value from this distribution.

member.name: M:ElecNetKit.Util.NormalDist.#ctor
member.summary: Instantiates a new Normal Distribution, with Mean = 0 and Std Dev = 1.

member.name: T:ElecNetKit.Simulator.NetworkController
member.summary: A class that governs the production of a network model, experimenting on the network model and transforming the results (all as requested). Capable of working with any , and will automatically detect and use any available simulator in the /ElecNetKitExtensions subfolder of the entry assembly ()'s location.

member.name: F:ElecNetKit.Simulator.NetworkController.simulator
member.summary: The simulator to be used by the system.

member.name: M:ElecNetKit.Simulator.NetworkController.ClearNetworkCache
member.summary: Forces the pre-experiment network to be recalculated.

member.name: M:ElecNetKit.Simulator.NetworkController.#ctor(ElecNetKit.Simulator.ISimulator)
member.summary: Instantiates a using the provided simulator.
member.param: The simulator object to use for simulations.

member.name: M:ElecNetKit.Simulator.NetworkController.Execute
member.summary: Runs the simulation, and an experiment (, if specified), and applies a results transform (, if specified). After simulation has been run, the network can be retrieved for plotting/analysis.

member.name: P:ElecNetKit.Simulator.NetworkController.NetworkFilename
member.summary: The filename corresponding to a stored network model. The network model should define the network but not (necessarily) solve anything.

member.name: P:ElecNetKit.Simulator.NetworkController.ExperimentDriver
member.summary: The particular experiment that will be applied to the network.

member.name: P:ElecNetKit.Simulator.NetworkController.ResultsTransformer
member.summary: The to be used in the experiment.

member.name: P:ElecNetKit.Simulator.NetworkController.Network
member.summary: The simulated network. Only avaiable once Execute() has been called.

member.name: P:ElecNetKit.Simulator.NetworkController.CacheNetwork
member.summary: A flag indicating, if set, that the should only ever obtain the pre-experiment network from the simulator once. Default value is true.
member.remarks: Note that setting to true will not persist the modifications made after experimentation. is only designed to be used for performance improvement. If you wish to combine multiple experiments into one, use instead.

member.name: T:ElecNetKit.Simulator.ISimulator
member.summary: Defines an electrical network simulator. Simulators must be able to run textual commands and return network models.
member.example: For an example implemention, see the ElecNetKit.Engines.OpenDSS assembly.

member.name: M:ElecNetKit.Simulator.ISimulator.RunCommand(System.String)
member.summary: Run a single command through the simulator text interface.
member.param: The command to run.

member.name: M:ElecNetKit.Simulator.ISimulator.PrepareNetwork(System.String)
member.summary: Signals that the should load a network model from , ready to be returned as a or experimented upon.

member.name: M:ElecNetKit.Simulator.ISimulator.GetNetworkModel
member.summary: Finalises all experiment commands, solves and retrieves all results and returns a , characterising the electrical network.
member.returns: The complete electrical network model.

member.name: T:ElecNetKit.Util.Limits
member.summary: Automatically determines the minimum and maximum values for a data set. Manual limits ( and ) can also be specified, and then values can be scaled from the Auto-space to the Manual-space, and vice-versa.

member.name: M:ElecNetKit.Util.Limits.#ctor
member.summary: Instantiates a new .

member.returns: A fractional value indicating how far between the Minimum and Maximum the value is.

member.summary: Processes a set of data.
